department.dept_long_name: Department of African and African American Studies

course.title: Queer of Color Theory
course.description: An advanced seminar in theories and processes of theory-making by queer people of color in the US from the Harlem Renaissance through the present. Topics include feminism, AIDS, spirituality, community, migration, affect, and performance. Texts include works by Audre Lorde, Cherrie Moraga, Gloria Anzladua, Marlon Riggs, Cathy Cohen, E. Patrick Johnson, Jose Esteban Munoz, Cheryl Dunye, David Eng, Sharon Bridgforth, Omi Osun Joni Jones, Roderick Ferguson, and Jewelle Gomez.
